required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reaching and Engaging Depressed Senior Center Clients
clinical_study.official_title: Reaching and Engaging Depressed Senior Center Clients Phase II

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the feasibility of one type of therapy session, Virtual Augmented Engage (Engage-A). The research is being done because the researchers are trying to learn if these approaches could be used by therapists in the community social service agencies to treat older adults with depression. The research will also measure clinician satisfaction after training and supervision of utilization of Engage-A.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants who Attend Every Scheduled Therapy Session
primary_outcome.description: Number of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants who Attend Every Scheduled Therapy Session

primary_outcome.measure: Average Satisfaction Score of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants as measured by the CSQ
primary_outcome.description: The Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ) assesses the clients' satisfaction with the services they are receiving. The CSQ ranges from 1-4, with higher scores indicating higher satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Satisfaction Score of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants as measured by the CSQ
primary_outcome.description: The Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ) assesses the clients' satisfaction with the services they are receiving. The CSQ ranges from 1-4, with higher scores indicating higher satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Satisfaction Score of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants as measured by the CSQ
primary_outcome.description: The Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ) assesses the clients' satisfaction with the services they are receiving. The CSQ ranges from 1-4, with higher scores indicating higher satisfaction.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Satisfaction Score of Community Clinicians (LCSW) as measured by the TSQ
primary_outcome.description: The Therapist Satisfaction Questionnaire (TSQ) assesses the therapists' satisfaction with the Alacrity therapy training and intervention. The TSQ ranges from 1-4, with higher scores indicating higher satisfaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Depressive Symptoms of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants as measured by HAM-D
secondary_outcome.description: Hamilton Depression Rating Score (HAM-D) assesses the severity of depression in patients. The HAM-D ranges from 0 to 52, with higher scores indicating higher severity of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Behavioral Activation of Virtual ENGAGE-A Participants as measured by the BADS
secondary_outcome.description: The Behavioral Activation for Depression Scale (BADS) measures levels of behavioral activation. The BADS ranges from 0 to 150, with higher scores indicating lower levels of behavioral activation.

arm_group.description: Participants receive 9 individual in-person or remote therapy sessions. Each session will last approximately 60 minutes. During the sessions, the therapist will encourage the participant to engage in physical and social activities that are pleasurable or rewarding.
Clinicians will be trained in Engage-A and supervised while utilizing the therapy.

intervention.description: Therapist will encourage participants to engage in physical and social activities that are pleasurable or rewarding. Engage is a stepped care psychotherapy based on what is known about how older adults respond to depression interventions. Stepped care is a model of treatment that starts with the minimum effective therapeutic techniques first, and then based on how well people respond to treatment, additional therapeutic techniques are added until people are recovered from their depression.
Therapist will be trained in Engage-A therapy and given supervision while utilizing this therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 55 years' old
- PHQ-9 Score of ≥ 10
- English or Spanish speaking
- MOCA ≥ 24 or mini-telephone MOCA ≥ 11
- Member of/attends one of the REDS Senior Centers
- Capacity to provide written consent for both research assessment and the Engage-A intervention.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current active suicidal ideation defined by MADRS Suicide Item ≥ 4 (probably better off dead. Suicidal thoughts are common, and suicide is considered as a possible solution, but without specific plans or intention).
- Presence of psychiatric diagnoses other than unipolar, non-psychotic major depression or generalized anxiety disorder by SCID-IV.
- Severe or life-threatening medical illness (e.g., end stage organ failure).
- Currently seeing an individual psychotherapist *(if individuals are willing to go on a hiatus from their individual psychotherapist for the 15 weeks of the study, and meet all inclusion criteria, they will be considered eligible).

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data from this study is submitted to the National Database for Clinical Trials related to Mental Illness (NDCT). The NDCT is run by NIH and allows researchers studying mental health to collect and share information with each other. Researchers must apply to NIH in order to be allowed access to the data for 1 year's time; after which they must re-apply.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available as per NIMH's data sharing policy.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access criteria is determined by NIMH and can be requested by applying online.
